meanings.definition: To cause great damage or harm to something
meanings.sent1: The storm will destroy the old barn.
meanings.sent2: The fire can destroy a forest in minutes.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous puppy tried to destroy my favorite shoes.
meanings.sent4: The virus can destroy a computer's files without warning.
meanings.sent5: The earthquake's power to destroy buildings is frightening.

meanings.definition: To completely ruin or demolish something
meanings.sent1: The wrecking ball will destroy the old building.
meanings.sent2: Leaving food out can destroy its freshness quickly.
meanings.sent3: The magician's trick seemed to destroy the playing card.
meanings.sent4: The loud noise can destroy the peaceful atmosphere of the park.
meanings.sent5: The toddler's tantrum has the power to destroy a calm moment.

meanings.definition: To put an end to the existence of something
meanings.sent1: The dictator sought to destroy any opposition to his rule.
meanings.sent2: A single mistake can destroy a person's reputation.
meanings.sent3: The superhero's mission is to destroy evil in the city.
meanings.sent4: The final blow will destroy the villain's evil plans.
meanings.sent5: The scientist's invention could destroy the world if misused.
